# Do not make any changes in this cell
# Simply execute it and move on

import pandas as pd  
import numpy as np 
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import json
ans = [0]*8

# Simply execute this cell and move on

#Import the dataset and define the feature as well as the target datasets / columns  
dataset = pd.read_csv('heart.csv')  
#We drop the 'trestbps','chol','thalach','oldpeak' as they have numerical values  
dataset=dataset.drop('trestbps',axis=1) 
dataset=dataset.drop('chol',axis=1) 
dataset=dataset.drop('thalach',axis=1) 
dataset=dataset.drop('oldpeak',axis=1) 
dataset

source: plt.hist(dataset.age)

#These are the meanings of above features in the dataset
'''
age
sex
chest pain type (4 values)
resting blood pressure
serum cholestoral in mg/dl
fasting blood sugar > 120 mg/dl
resting electrocardiographic results (values 0,1,2)
maximum heart rate achieved
exercise induced angina
oldpeak = ST depression induced by exercise relative to rest
the slope of the peak exercise ST segment
number of major vessels (0-3) colored by flourosopy
thal: 3 = normal; 6 = fixed defect; 7 = reversable defect

sex

maximum heart rate achieved
exercise induced angina
oldpeak = ST depression induced by exercise relative to rest
the slope of the peak exercise ST segment
number of major vessels (0-3) colored by flourosopy
thal: 3 = normal; 6 = fixed defect; 7 = reversable defect

source:
# Divide the age feature  into groups 
# Group the data based on age (<30 , range(30,40) , range(40,50) ,  range(50,60) , range(60,70) , >=70 )
#              = [ -1 ,     0        ,     1        ,         2     ,          3   ,   4   ]

# Write code here
dataset['age'] = pd.cut(dataset['age'], [0,30, 40, 50, 60, 70,dataset['age'].max()+1], labels=['-1', '0', '1', '2', '3', '4'])
dataset.age.value_counts()

# QUESTION -1 :- (1mark)
#       Bayes theorm 
#       Find the following from the above data set 
#           - Find P("cp"=1,"thal"=2,"slope"=2 / Y=1) i.e.find the probability of ( "cp"=1 and "thal"=2 and "slope"=2 ) given that "target"=1
#       Assign your answer to ans[-1]

#Write code here
dataset_1=dataset[dataset['target']==1] #p(y)
d1=dataset_1[dataset_1['cp']==1] #p(cp+y)
d1=d1[d1['thal']==2] #p(thal+cp+y)
d1=d1[d1['slope']==2] #p(slope+thal+cp+y)

P=len(d1)/len(dataset_1) #P("cp"=1,"thal"=2,"slope"=2 / Y=1) = p(slope+thal+cp+y)/p(y)
P
#Write your answer here
ans[0]=P

# QUESTION -2 :- (1mark)
#       Find the prior distribution on the whole above data set , i.e. P(Y=1) and P(Y=0)
#       Enter value of P(Y=1) in ans[0]

# Write your code here
#P(Y)
#Prior distribution
p_1=len(dataset_1)/len(dataset)
p_0=1-(len(dataset_1)/len(dataset))

p_1
# Enter your answer here
ans[1]=p_1

# QUESTION -3:- (3marks)
#         Find the class conditional distribution on the above data set i.e. find P(X/Y)
#         Note: If class conditional probability = 0 assign 0.00000000000000001 (a low value) 
#         Find the class conditional probability of the feature "slope"= 0,1,2 when "target"=0 i.e. 
# P(X(slope)=i/Y=0) where i=0,1,2
#         Assign the answer to ans[1] in form of a list as [P(X(slope)=0/Y=0) , P(X(slope)=1/Y=0) ,
# P(X(slope)=2/Y=0)]

#Write your code below
#Class conditional distribution
#P(x/y)
def find_p_xy(dataset,feature,num):
  p_s_0=len(dataset[dataset[feature]==i])/len(dataset) #p(s+y)/p(y)
  if p_s_0==0:
    p_s_0=0.00000000000000001
  #print(p_s_0)
  return p_s_0

p_xy=[]
dataset_0=dataset[dataset['target']==0]

for i in range(len(dataset_0['slope'].unique())):
  p_s_0=find_p_xy(dataset_0,'slope',i)
  p_xy.append(p_s_0)
# Assign your answer here
ans[2]= p_xy

# QUESTION - 4:- (3marks)
#         Find the posterior distribution of the above dataset
#         i.e. Find P(Y/X) 
#         For X={"age":-1,'sex': 0,'cp':0 ,'fbs':1,'restecg':1,'exang':1,'slope':2,'ca':1,'thal':1}
#             - Find the label value (1 or 0) and also the respective confidence also the value of 
#               k in {  P(Y/X)=k*P(X1/Y)*P(X2/Y)*P(X3/Y)*P(X4/Y)......*P(Xn/Y)*P(Y) for n features   }
#         eg: if the answer is Y=0 with confidence =0.89 and k= 2100.8
#             your answer should be ans[2]=[0,0.89,2100.8]

#Write code here
# posterior distribution
#P(y/x)

p_x1_y=find_p_xy(dataset_1,'age',-1)
p_x2_y=find_p_xy(dataset_1,'sex',0)
p_x3_y=find_p_xy(dataset_1,'cp',0)
p_x4_y=find_p_xy(dataset_1,'fbs',1)
p_x5_y=find_p_xy(dataset_1,'restecg',1)
p_x6_y=find_p_xy(dataset_1,'exang',1)
p_x7_y=find_p_xy(dataset_1,'slope',2)
p_x8_y=find_p_xy(dataset_1,'ca',1)
p_x9_y=find_p_xy(dataset_1,'thal',1)

p_x1_y0=find_p_xy(dataset_0,'age',-1)
p_x2_y0=find_p_xy(dataset_0,'sex',0)
p_x3_y0=find_p_xy(dataset_0,'cp',0)
p_x4_y0=find_p_xy(dataset_0,'fbs',1)
p_x5_y0=find_p_xy(dataset_0,'restecg',1)
p_x6_y0=find_p_xy(dataset_0,'exang',1)
p_x7_y0=find_p_xy(dataset_0,'slope',2)
p_x8_y0=find_p_xy(dataset_0,'ca',1)
p_x9_y0=find_p_xy(dataset_0,'thal',1)

# p_1_x_=p_x1_y*p_x2_y*p_x3_y*p_x4_y*p_x5_y*p_x6_y*p_x7_y*p_x8_y*p_1
p1 = np.log(p_x1_y)+np.log(p_x2_y)+np.log(p_x3_y)+np.log(p_x4_y)+np.log(p_x5_y)+np.log(p_x6_y)+np.log(p_x7_y)+np.log(p_x8_y)+np.log(p_x9_y)+np.log(p_1)
# p_0_x_=p_x1_y0*p_x2_y0*p_x3_y0*p_x4_y0*p_x5_y0*p_x6_y0*p_x7_y0*p_x8_y0*p_0
p0 = np.log(p_x1_y0)+np.log(p_x2_y0)+np.log(p_x3_y0)+np.log(p_x4_y0)+np.log(p_x5_y0)+np.log(p_x6_y0)+np.log(p_x7_y0)+np.log(p_x8_y0)+np.log(p_x9_y0)+np.log(p_0)
# print(p_1_x_, p_0_x_)
p1 = np.exp(p1)
p0 = np.exp(p0)
print(p1,p0)
# k=1./(p_0_x_+p_1_x_)
k = 1./(p1+p0)
p_1_x=p1*k
p_0_x=p0*k

pred=int(p_1_x>0.5)

[pred, p_1_x, p_0_x, k]
#Write your answers here

# Splitting the data for fitting a library naive bayes model from sklearn
# Use train_test_split to split the data
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split

X=dataset.drop(columns=['target'])
y=dataset['target']

# Split the data into train and test (train-90% and test-10%)
# Strictly use (randon_state = 42) in train_test_split ,so that your answer can be evaluated

# Write your code here 

x_train,x_test,y_train,y_test=train_test_split(X,y,random_state=42,test_size=0.1)

# QUESTION - 5 :- (2marks)
#         Import the  GaussianNB  model from sklearn and find the no of wrong predictions on the testing set
# i.e. train and fit the model on the training set and predict the output if the heart disease exists or not 
#         Compare the predicted and the testing labels and enter the no.of wrongly predicted lables in ans[3]

#Importing the Gaussian naive bayes classifier model from sklearn

from sklearn.naive_bayes import GaussianNB

#Write your code below
model=GaussianNB()
model.fit(x_train,y_train)

ypred=model.predict(x_test)
wrong=((ypred!=y_test)).sum()
((ypred!=y_test)).value_counts()

#Write your answers here

ans[4]=wrong #8

import json
ans = [str(item) for item in ans]

filename = "mansinumber1@gmail.com_Mansi_Uniyal_NaiveBayes"

# Eg if your name is Saurav Joshi and email id is sauravjoshi123@gmail.com, filename becomes
# filename = sauravjoshi123@gmail.com_Saurav_Joshi_NaiveBayes
## Do not change anything below!!
- Make sure you have changed the above variable "filename" with the correct value. Do not change anything below!!

from importlib import import_module
import os
from pprint import pprint

findScore = import_module('findScore')
response = findScore.main(ans)
response['details'] = filename
with open(f'evaluation_{filename}.json', 'w') as outfile:
    json.dump(response, outfile)
pprint(response)
